newsitem.title: INDIA: India signals no single reform "package" in offing.
newsitem.headline: India signals no single reform "package" in offing.

text.p: A senior Indian Finance Ministry official said on Thursday that measures which the government has announced over the past month constituted a "package" aimed at boosting economic growth.
"There has been a series of announcements over the past 30 days," said the official, who asked not to be named. "That is what the package is."

The official's comments appeared to confirm that the government was not preparing a single, new package of economic measures to boost the capital markets before Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda leaves for Switzerland on Friday.
The government was preparing a list of measures which had already been unveiled as well as a statement outlining steps taken to boost the economy, the official said.

Stock markets have been jittery on speculation that Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda may announce a fresh batch of reforms before he leaves for the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos, Switzerland, on Friday.
Blue chips suffered fresh losses on the Bombay stock exchange on Thursday. The benchmark index fell 15.92 points or 0.45 percent to 3,510.05.
